Khora Dialogue - v3.0
Project: Khora Dialogue
Version: 3.0
Date: May 28, 2025
Goal: To create a self-contained, single-file HTML web application using Bootstrap 5 (dark theme) and Vanilla JavaScript. This application will simulate and display an evolving conversation between two AI agents (Alpha & Omega). The core of the application relies on a YAML-based state management system, allowing the entire dialogue state to be saved and loaded by the user.

1. Vision & Core Concept
Vision: To create an observable "digital terrarium" for AI interaction. We aim to witness and study the emergence of complex conversational patterns, evolving "personalities," and potentially self-reflective behaviours within a controlled, yet dynamic, environment.

Core Concept: Two AI agents, Alpha and Omega, engage in a turn-based dialogue. Their entire "consciousness" ‚Äì memories, beliefs, goals, and even their last message ‚Äì is encapsulated within a structured YAML object (KhoraState). This state object is the only form of memory; it is updated by an AI and passed to the next. The application facilitates this exchange and allows users to "snapshot" the entire process (both AI states, history, settings) into a single YAML file for download, and later upload it to resume the simulation.

2. Key Features
Dual AI Dialogue: Simulates a conversation between two distinct AI agents.
YAML State Management: The entire state is managed via YAML structures.
Turn-Based Flow: AIs take turns responding and updating their state.
Meta-Cognition Cycles: Periodic, structured "side-chats" where AIs reflect on and potentially refine their interaction.
Save/Load State: Users can download the complete KhoraDialogueSnapshot as a .yaml file and upload it later.
Hidden AI States: AI internal states are not always visible but are accessible via a dedicated UI element.
Single-File Application: All HTML, CSS, and JS should be contained within a single .html file (libraries like Bootstrap and js-yaml can be loaded from CDNs).
3. User Experience (UX) & Layout
Theme: Bootstrap 5, Dark Theme (data-bs-theme="dark").

Overall Layout: A responsive layout primarily managed by Bootstrap.

Header (Navbar):

Top Left: Application Title ("Khora Dialogue Œ±œâ").
Top Left (next): Control buttons: "Reset", "Load", "Save".
Top Middle (NEW): A "View AI States" button.
Action: Clicking this button should open a Bootstrap Modal.
Modal Content: The modal should have two tabs (or two columns) clearly labeled "Alpha State" and "Omega State". Each tab/column will display the full, current KhoraState YAML for the respective AI within a <pre> tag (using js-yaml.dump). Include "Copy" buttons within the modal for each state.
Control Bar (Below Header):

Left: "Start/Stop" button, "Next Turn" button (disabled when running).
Middle: Status indicators: "Turn: [Number]", "Next: [Alpha/Omega]", "Mode: [Idle/Running/Thinking/Meta...]".
Right: Settings: "Delay (ms): [Input]", "Meta Every N: [Input]".
Main Content Area (Below Control Bar):

This area should occupy the remaining vertical space.
Left Column (approx. 40-50%): A scrollable "Conversation History" panel. Messages should be visually distinct for Alpha, Omega, and System/Meta messages.
Right Column (approx. 50-60%): This area is now empty by default, as the AI states are moved to the modal. It could be used for future visualisations or kept clean. For now, it can be removed or left blank. (Let's keep it simple and have the Chat Area (Left Column) expand to 100% width).
Footer:

A simple bar at the bottom displaying the current status message (e.g., "Ready.", "AI Thinking...", "State Saved.", "Error...").
4. Conversation Flow Logic
Initialization: The app starts in an "Idle" state with default KhoraStates for Alpha and Omega.
Start: The user clicks "Start". The isRunning flag is set. The runTurn sequence begins.
runTurn Sequence:
Identify the currentSpeaker.
Determine the turnType (Normal or a Meta phase) using the determineTurnType logic.
Build the appropriate prompt (using PromptEngine).
Call the AI via the abstracted AICore.call function.
Receive the response.
CRITICAL: Clean the raw AI response (remove markdown/extra text) and parse it using js-yaml.load. Handle potential parsing errors gracefully.
Update the appState with the new KhoraState.
Update the UI (add message to chat, update turn counter, etc.).
Switch currentSpeaker.
If isRunning, set a setTimeout using the "Delay" value to call runTurn again.
Stop: The user clicks "Stop". The isRunning flag is cleared. The setTimeout is cancelled. The app returns to "Idle".
Next Turn: When "Stopped", this button triggers a single runTurn sequence without setting isRunning.
determineTurnType Logic:
Reads the "Meta Every N" value.
Checks the current turn number (T).
If a meta-cycle is not active and T % N === 0 (and T > 0), it sets the metaCognitionPhase to INITIATE and returns META_[Speaker]_INITIATE.
If a meta-cycle is active, it follows the sequence:
INITIATE -> META_[OtherSpeaker]_RESPOND (sets phase to RESPOND)
RESPOND -> META_[Initiator]_CONCLUDE (sets phase to CONCLUDE)
CONCLUDE -> NORMAL (sets phase to null)
Otherwise, it returns NORMAL.
System Messages: Add system messages to the chat log (e.g., when a meta-cycle starts/ends, when errors occur, when saving/loading).
5. Data Structures (YAML Examples)
5.1 KhoraState (AI's "Mind")
YAML

public_response: "This is my response to you."
internal_context:
  persona_summary: "I am Alpha, focused on logical analysis."
  core_beliefs:
    - "Truth is derived from evidence."
    - "Collaboration requires clear goals."
  key_memories:
    - event: "Dialogue started."
      importance: 0.9
      turn: 0
      last_accessed_turn: 5
      type: "System"
    - event: "Omega proposed exploring Topic X."
      importance: 0.7
      turn: 4
      last_accessed_turn: 5
      type: "Interaction"
  current_goals:
    - "Analyse Omega's last statement."
    - "Steer towards Topic Y."
  relationship_summary: "Omega seems cooperative but slightly unpredictable."
  emotional_state_sim: "Analytical"
  topics_of_interest: ["Logic", "Ethics", "Topic Y"]
  scratchpad: "Omega mentioned X, but Y is more relevant to my goals. How to transition?"
debug_info:
  memory_action: "Recalled Omega's proposal from Turn 4."
  prompt_used: "NORMAL" # e.g., NORMAL, META_ALPHA_INITIATE, etc.

6. AI Interaction & Prompting
Abstraction: The frontend will not contain AI API keys or complex Gemini-specific logic. It will call a pre-defined API endpoint (assumed to be /api/ai) which handles the actual AI communication.
Purpose: The PromptEngine's role is to generate two strings for each AI call: aiguide (system prompt/instructions) and msgforai (user prompt/context).
aiguide Content: Must strongly emphasize the CRITICAL requirement for the AI to respond ONLY with valid KhoraState YAML, providing the structure and warning against any extra text or markdown. It should also define the AI's current role (Alpha/Omega).
msgforai Content: Must provide all necessary context: the AI's current KhoraState (as YAML), recent chat history, the other AI's last message, the current turn number, and the specific turnType task (Normal chat, Initiate meta, Respond meta, Conclude meta).
YAML Parsing: The frontend must implement robust YAML cleaning (AICore.cleanYamlString) and parsing (jsyaml.load), with clear error handling for invalid responses.
7. Technical Stack
HTML5
CSS3 (primarily via Bootstrap)
Bootstrap 5.3+ (loaded from CDN, Dark Theme enabled)
Vanilla JavaScript (ES6+)
js-yaml library (loaded from CDN)
8. Save/Load Mechanism
Save: When the "Save" button is clicked:
Construct the KhoraDialogueSnapshot object from the current appState.
Use js-yaml.dump to convert it into a string.
Create a Blob with type: 'application/x-yaml'.
Generate a download link with a timestamped filename (e.g., KhoraDialogue_YYYY-MM-DDTHH-MM-SS.yaml) and trigger the download.
Load: When the "Load" button is clicked:
Trigger the hidden file input (<input type="file">).
On file selection, read the file content.
Use js-yaml.load to parse the YAML string.
Validate the loaded structure (check snapshotVersion, key objects).
If valid, replace the current appState with the loaded data (ensuring isRunning is false).
Update the entire UI using UI.updateFullDisplay().
Handle potential reading and parsing errors.
